simplesect.title: DESCRIPTION
simplesect.simpara: Read the .idx file for a Git packfile (created with or ) from the standard input, and dump its contents. The output consists of one object per line, with each line containing two or three space-separated columns:

listitem.simpara: the first column is the offset in bytes of the object within the corresponding packfile
the second column is the object id of the object
if the index version is 2 or higher, the third column contains the CRC32 of the object data

simplesect.simpara: The objects are output in the order in which they are found in the index file, which should be (in a correctly constructed file) sorted by object id.
Note that you can get more information on a packfile by calling . However, as this command considers only the index file itself, it's both faster and more flexible.

listitem.simpara: Specify the given object format (hash algorithm) for the index file. The valid values are sha1 and (if enabled) sha256. The default is the algorithm for the current repository (set by extensions.objectFormat), or sha1 if no value is set or outside a repository..
